titleInfo.title: Jim Bulleit face-to-face Interview Tape 1 of 2

mods.accessCondition: This audio file is the property of the Country Music Hall of Fame© and Museum and may be protected by U.S. and international copyright laws. To inquire about use permissions and obtain a high-quality version of this, contact audio@countrymusichalloffame.org. Please cite audio file information in email.
mods.abstract: Record industry pioneer Jim Bulleit talks about his career in the music business, focusing on his WSM days, his record label Bullet Records, and his work as a booking agent. Discussion includes various artists from the Bullet catalogue; the contract arrangement for Bullet artists; WSM programming and personalities; Bullet distribution and promotion; opening the first record processing plant in Nashville; the end of Bullet Records; the Village and Delta record labels; his publishing interests; Lefty Frizzell and Don Law; overseeing the booking and the artists for the Louisiana Hayride; his work at Sun Records; the attempt to revive Bullet Records; and memories of Fred Rose.

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum
